teaching.topicTitle: Review of Proper Seating and Pencil Grip
teaching.topicContent: Recap the correct way to sit at a table for comfortable writing.Review holding the pencil correctly to promote good handwriting posture.
Build upon the concept of pre-cursive handwriting and its significance.Discuss the progression from print to cursive writing.
Introduce more complex lower-case letters with loops and curves. Emphasize the correct starting and finishing points for each letter.
Continue with the formation of complex lower-case letters.Include letters with straight lines and diagonal strokes.

teaching.topicTitle: Practicing Capital Letters, Digits, and Punctuation
teaching.topicContent: Extend practice to forming capital letters, digits (0-9), and common punctuation marks. Focus on maintaining size, alignment, and clarity.
Dive deeper into handwriting families and their shared formations.  Allow students to practice letters within the same family.

teaching.topicTitle: Perfecting Lower-Case Letter Sizing and Consistency
teaching.topicContent: Refine the technique of keeping lower-case letters proportionate to each other.Discuss the importance of uniformity in letter size.

teaching.topicTitle: Applying Advanced Diagonal and Horizontal Strokes
teaching.topicContent: Expand the use of diagonal and horizontal strokes in joining letters. Identify which letters are best left unjoined when adjacent.

teaching.topicTitle: Enhanced Joining of Letters - Curves and Diagonals
teaching.topicContent: Progress to joining complex letters with curves and diagonal strokes.  Provide exercises to reinforce smooth connections.

teaching.topicTitle: Enhanced Joining of Letters - Straights and Diagonals
teaching.topicContent: Continue advancing the skill of joining letters.Practice joining letters with straight lines and diagonal strokes.
Revisit the formation of capital letters in a more advanced manner.Emphasize consistent size, alignment, and proportional relationships.
Teach students to leave consistent spacing between words. Discuss how spacing complements letter and word size.

teaching.topicTitle: Integrating Complex Diagonal and Horizontal Strokes
teaching.topicContent: Incorporate intricate diagonal and horizontal strokes into writing.Guide students in applying these strokes within words.

teaching.topicTitle: Crafting Sentences with Complex Letter Joins
teaching.topicContent: Have students construct sentences with complex joined letters.Focus on maintaining legibility and smooth transitions.

teaching.topicTitle: Revisiting and Advancing Cursive Capital Letters
teaching.topicContent: Review and refine the formation of cursive capital letters.Ensure adherence to size, shape, and alignment.
Guide students in writing longer sentences with expression. Encourage them to maintain consistent spacing and rhythm.
Provide additional practice for forming lower-case letters.Address any areas where students may need improvement.
Provide additional practice for forming complex lower-case letters.Address any specific areas where students require improvement.

teaching.topicTitle: Mastering the Art of Joining Letters
teaching.topicContent: Guide students in seamlessly joining letters within words and sentences.Encourage them to create smooth, flowing handwriting.
Have students compose paragraphs in pre-cursive handwriting.Emphasize organization, coherence, and consistency.
Practice joining letters within longer passages of text. Focus on maintaining a steady rhythm and connection.
Assign projects involving more extensive writing tasks. Showcase students' pre-cursive handwriting skills in projects.
Engage students in peer editing to enhance their handwriting.Foster a supportive environment for constructive feedback..
Introduce digital tools for practicing pre-cursive handwriting. Use interactive platforms to reinforce proper letter formation.

teaching.topicTitle: Reflecting on Handwriting Progress and Goals
teaching.topicContent: Encourage students to reflect on their handwriting journey. Help them identify areas of growth and set future goals.
Guide students in using their pre-cursive handwriting in real-life situations. Emphasize the role of clear and legible writing in effective communication.
Celebrate students' accomplishments in mastering pre-cursive handwriting. Display their improved handwriting in a classroom exhibit or project.

test.description: Put your Phonics and letter sound knowledge to the test.

questions.content: Write a step-by-step guide on how to brush your teeth properly.
Create instructions for making a peanut butter and jelly sandwich. Include all the necessary steps.
Write a procedure for planting a flower seed in a pot. Describe each step in detail.
Provide a guide on how to build a simple paper airplane. Explain the folding and flying steps.
Write down the steps to create a colorful, hand-drawn birthday card for a friend or family member.
Give instructions on how to tie your shoelaces correctly. Include all the necessary details.
Create a step-by-step guide for setting up a picnic in the park, including what food to bring and how to arrange everything.
Provide instructions on how to build a simple LEGO structure, like a house or a car. Describe the building steps clearly.
Write a procedure for planting a vegetable garden in your backyard. Include soil preparation, planting, and care steps.
Give directions on how to make a cup of hot cocoa with marshmallows. Describe the process in order.
Write a step-by-step guide on how to make a simple paper boat and test it in a container of water.
Provide instructions on how to make a healthy fruit salad. List the fruits and the steps to prepare the salad.
Write down the steps to build a sandcastle at the beach, including tips for making it sturdy and detailed.
Create a procedure for setting up a bird feeder in your backyard. Explain how to fill it, hang it, and attract birds.
Give instructions on how to draw your favorite animal. Include the shapes and details to make it look realistic.
Write a step-by-step guide on how to make a delicious and colorful fruit smoothie. List the ingredients and blending process.
Provide instructions for building a small, recycled materials robot like WackyTron. Explain how to assemble it and what it can do.
Write down the steps to create a piece of art using different types of pasta. Explain how to glue them to make a design.
Give directions on how to build a simple, kid-friendly obstacle course in your backyard. Include the obstacles and how to navigate them.
Create a procedure for making a mini science experiment using baking soda and vinegar. Explain what happens and why.
Write a step-by-step guide on how to plant a flower in a garden. Explain the tools, soil, and care needed for it to grow.
Provide instructions on how to create a colorful and informative poster for a school project. Include the materials and design tips.
Write down the steps to make a healthy and delicious homemade pizza. Include the dough, sauce, and toppings.
Create a procedure for making a creative and unique greeting card for a special occasion. Describe the design and message ideas.
Give directions on how to build a simple birdhouse for your backyard. Explain the measurements and painting options.
Write a step-by-step guide on how to make a kite and fly it successfully. Include materials and tips for launching.
Provide instructions on how to create a short dance routine. Describe the moves and music choices.
Write down the steps to make a colorful and tasty fruit popsicle. List the fruits and freezing process.
Create a procedure for setting up a mini science experiment using balloons and vinegar. Explain the chemical reaction and results.
Write a procedural writing piece on the topic of your your choice.
